text: in Mosul the smoldering aftermath of a
battle that didn't take long
the militants attacked just five days
ago on Monday the provincial governor
urged residents to hold firm hours later
he was gone Iraq's outgun security
forces weren't far behind
militants now controlled government
offices and banks - in January another
major city Fallujah fell to the same
hardline group the Islamic state in Iraq
and the Levant the government has tried
and failed to take it back tens of
thousands of people have fled Isis now
controls a broad swathe of territory
across the Middle East in Iraq sandbar
province Fallujah is still in rebel
hands and has been fighting in Ramadi -
in Syria the group is involved in
fighting in Aleppo and has a regional
base in Raqqa and now in a dramatic
extension of their influence they have
Mosul - this group of people now there's
tens of thousands of these guys and they
now have a territory they control
territory they control border crossing
points they control oil resources
mineral resources trade income they have
a base in the middle of the Middle East
the government in Baghdad has declared a
state of emergency but is struggling to
confront the militants for a while it
seemed Isis fighters were in control of
the town of Bhaiji whose major oil
refinery supplies much of the country
these unverified pictures appear to show
fighting before the militants reportedly
left meanwhile more dramatic images from
the situation around Mosul civilians
crossing the Tigris River to escape the
fighting Iraq is now in the grip of a
crisis as bad as anything since the
Americans left in 2011 Paul Adams BBC
news
